subject: Re: [junit] problems due to lack of annotation inheritance for methods
msgSnippet: ... No, we had to scrap it because inheritance of annotations brought up a number of ambiguous scenarios that would have been difficult to explain in a spec (I
messageBody:
On 6/28/06, Eric Silber <esilber@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks for the responses to my question.
>
> Apparently the original specs for Java annotations mandated inheritance of
> annotations, but
> some implementation issues caused that to be scrapped ( ??? ). Probably
> some performance issue?


No, we had to scrap it because inheritance of annotations brought up a
number of ambiguous scenarios that would have been difficult to explain in a
spec (I was on the JSR 175 Experts Group).

If TestNG supports annotation inheritance, has it implemented a feature
> which the Java folks specifically
> kept out of javac ?


Yes, I just implemented it the way I thought made sense. The only thorny
point is: what about interfaces? Right now, I decided to exclude them from
the inheritance search, and so far it hasn't been an issue, but I can always
revisit this if somebody makes a case (a strong case :-)) for it.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org
